meanings.definition: Something that causes disgust or disappointment.
meanings.sent1: The spoiled milk in the fridge was a real sickener.
meanings.sent2: The rotten smell from the garbage was a sickener for everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: Finding a worm in his apple was a sickener for Tim, but he still ate it.
meanings.sent4: The news of the canceled concert was a sickener to all the fans who had been waiting for months.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the overflowing trash can was a sickener that stayed in my mind all day.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes someone feel sick or disgusted.
meanings.sent1: The bully at school was a sickener to the other kids.
meanings.sent2: The slimy texture of the food was a sickener for Sarah.
meanings.sent3: The creepy crawly spider was a sickener for Jane, but her brother found it fascinating.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the decaying fruit was a sickener that made my stomach turn.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the spoiled milk was a sickener that made me gag.

meanings.definition: An event or situation that causes extreme disappointment or distress.
meanings.sent1: The last-minute cancellation of the trip was a sickener for the whole family.
meanings.sent2: Losing the championship game was a sickener for the team.
meanings.sent3: The sudden rainstorm was a sickener for the outdoor wedding, but they all laughed and danced in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected betrayal was a sickener that shattered her trust in people.
meanings.sent5: The failed experiment was a sickener that left the scientists feeling defeated.
